00050 fsal_status_t FSAL_lookup (
00051     fsal_handle_t         * p_parent_directory_handle,        /* IN */
00052     fsal_name_t           * p_filename,                     /* IN */
00053     fsal_op_context_t     * p_context,                      /* IN */
00054     fsal_handle_t         * p_object_handle,                  /* OUT */
00055     fsal_attrib_list_t    * p_object_attributes               /* [ IN/OUT ] */
00056 ){
00057   int rc, errsv;
00058   fsal_status_t             status;
00059   fsal_posixdb_status_t     statusdb;
00060   fsal_posixdb_fileinfo_t   infofs;
00061   struct stat               buffstat;
00062   fsal_path_t pathfsal;
00063 
00064   /* sanity checks
00065    * note : object_attributes is optionnal
00066    *        parent_directory_handle may be null for getting FS root.
00067    */
00068   if (!p_object_handle || !p_context )
00069     Return(ERR_FSAL_FAULT ,0 , INDEX_FSAL_lookup);
00070   
00071     
00072   /* filename is NULL => lookup "/" */
00073   if ( (p_parent_directory_handle && !p_filename) || (!p_parent_directory_handle && p_filename) )
00074     Return(ERR_FSAL_FAULT ,0 , INDEX_FSAL_lookup);
00075  
00076   /* get informations about the parent */
00077   if (!p_parent_directory_handle){ /* lookup '/' */
00078     TakeTokenFSCall();
00079     rc = lstat("/", &buffstat);
00080     errsv = errno;
00081     ReleaseTokenFSCall();
00082     if ( rc ) Return(posix2fsal_error(errsv) ,errsv , INDEX_FSAL_lookup);
00083   } else {
00084     status = fsal_internal_getPathFromHandle(p_context, p_parent_directory_handle, 1, &pathfsal, &buffstat);
00085     if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(status)) Return(status.major, status.minor, INDEX_FSAL_lookup);
00086   }
00087   
00088   /* Be careful about junction crossing, symlinks, hardlinks,... */
00089   switch ( posix2fsal_type(buffstat.st_mode) )
00090   {
00091     case FSAL_TYPE_DIR:
00092       // OK
00093       break;
00094     
00095     case FSAL_TYPE_JUNCTION:
00096        // This is a junction
00097        Return(ERR_FSAL_XDEV,0,INDEX_FSAL_lookup);
00098       
00099     case FSAL_TYPE_FILE:
00100     case FSAL_TYPE_LNK:
00101     case FSAL_TYPE_XATTR:
00102       // not a directory 
00103       Return(ERR_FSAL_NOTDIR,0,INDEX_FSAL_lookup);
00104       
00105     default:
00106       Return(ERR_FSAL_SERVERFAULT ,0 , INDEX_FSAL_lookup);
00107   }
00108  
00109   if ( !p_parent_directory_handle ) { /* lookup '/' */
00110       /* convert struct stat to fsal_posixdb_fileinfo_t */
00111 
00112       if (FSAL_IS_ERROR( status = fsal_internal_posix2posixdb_fileinfo(&buffstat, &infofs) ) )
00113         Return(status.major, status.minor, INDEX_FSAL_lookup);
00114 
00115       /* get The handle of '/' */
00116       status = fsal_internal_getInfoFromName( p_context, NULL, NULL, &infofs, p_object_handle);
00117       if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(status)) Return(status.major, status.minor, INDEX_FSAL_lookup);
00118       
00119   } else {
00120 
00121 #ifdef _DEBUG_FSAL    
00122     fprintf(stderr, "lookup of %llu.%i/%s\n", p_parent_directory_handle->id, p_parent_directory_handle->ts, p_filename->name );
00123 #endif
00124         
00125     /* check rights to enter into the directory */
00126     status = fsal_internal_testAccess( p_context, FSAL_X_OK, &buffstat, NULL );
00127     if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(status)) Return(status.major,status.minor,INDEX_FSAL_lookup);
00128     
00129     /* stat the file to see if it exists and get some information */
00130     status = fsal_internal_appendFSALNameToFSALPath(&pathfsal, p_filename);
00131     if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(status)) Return(status.major,status.minor,INDEX_FSAL_lookup);
00132     
00133     TakeTokenFSCall();
00134     rc = lstat( pathfsal.path, &buffstat );
00135     errsv = errno;
00136     ReleaseTokenFSCall();
00137     if ( rc ) Return(posix2fsal_error(errsv) ,errsv , INDEX_FSAL_lookup);
00138     
00139     
00140     /* getHandleFromName */
00141     if ( !FSAL_namecmp(p_filename, &FSAL_DOT) ) {
00142       /* lookup "." */
00143       memcpy( p_object_handle, p_parent_directory_handle, sizeof(fsal_handle_t) );
00144       
00145     } else if ( !FSAL_namecmp(p_filename, &FSAL_DOT_DOT) ) {
00146       /* lookup ".." */
00147       statusdb = fsal_posixdb_getParentDirHandle( p_context->p_conn,
00148                                                   p_parent_directory_handle,
00149                                                   p_object_handle
00150                                                 );
00151 
00152     } else {
00153       /* convert struct stat to fsal_posixdb_fileinfo_t */
00154       if (FSAL_IS_ERROR( status = fsal_internal_posix2posixdb_fileinfo(&buffstat, &infofs) ) )
00155         Return(status.major, status.minor, INDEX_FSAL_lookup);
00156 
00157       /* get The handle of the file */
00158       status = fsal_internal_getInfoFromName( p_context, p_parent_directory_handle, p_filename, &infofs, p_object_handle);
00159       if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(status)) Return(status.major, status.minor, INDEX_FSAL_lookup);
00160     }
00161 
00162   }
00163     
00164   if ( p_object_attributes ) {
00165     
00166     /* convert posix attributes to fsal attributes */
00167     status = posix2fsal_attributes( 
00168                          &buffstat,
00169                          p_object_attributes );
00170     
00171     if ( FSAL_IS_ERROR( status ) )
00172     {
00173       FSAL_CLEAR_MASK( p_object_attributes->asked_attributes );
00174       FSAL_SET_MASK( p_object_attributes->asked_attributes,
00175           FSAL_ATTR_RDATTR_ERR );
00176     }
00177   }
00178     
00179   
00180   /* lookup complete ! */
00181   Return( ERR_FSAL_NO_ERROR, 0 ,INDEX_FSAL_lookup );
00182 
00183 }

00210 fsal_status_t FSAL_lookupPath (
00211     fsal_path_t           * p_path,            /* IN */
00212     fsal_op_context_t     * p_context,         /* IN */
00213     fsal_handle_t         * object_handle,     /* OUT */
00214     fsal_attrib_list_t    * object_attributes  /* [ IN/OUT ] */
00215 ){
00216   fsal_name_t obj_name = FSAL_NAME_INITIALIZER; /* empty string */
00217   char * ptr_str;
00218   fsal_handle_t out_hdl;
00219   fsal_status_t status;
00220   int b_is_last = FALSE; /* is it the last lookup ? */
00221   
00222   /* sanity checks
00223    * note : object_attributes is optionnal.
00224    */
00225   
00226   if (!object_handle || !p_context || !p_path)
00227     Return(ERR_FSAL_FAULT ,0 , INDEX_FSAL_lookupPath);
00228   
00229   /* test whether the path begins with a slash*/
00230   
00231   if ( p_path->path[0] != '/' )
00232     Return(ERR_FSAL_INVAL,0,INDEX_FSAL_lookupPath);   
00233   
00234   /* the pointer now points on the next name in the path,
00235    * skipping slashes.
00236    */
00237   
00238   ptr_str = p_path->path + 1;
00239   while (ptr_str[0] == '/') ptr_str++;
00240   
00241   /* is the next name empty ? */
00242   
00243   if (ptr_str[0] == '\0')  b_is_last = TRUE;
00244      
00245   
00246   /* retrieves root directory */
00247   
00248   status = FSAL_lookup (  NULL,     /* looking up for root */
00249                           NULL, /* empty string to get root handle */
00250                           p_context,     /* user's p_contextentials */
00251                           &out_hdl, /* output root handle */
00252                           /* retrieves attributes if this is the last lookup :*/
00253                           ( b_is_last ? object_attributes : NULL ));
00254   
00255   if (  FSAL_IS_ERROR( status ))
00256     Return( status.major, status.minor,INDEX_FSAL_lookupPath );
00257   
00258   
00259   /* exits if this was the last lookup */
00260   
00261   if  ( b_is_last ){
00262     (*object_handle) = out_hdl;
00263     Return( ERR_FSAL_NO_ERROR, 0 ,INDEX_FSAL_lookupPath );
00264   }
00265   
00266   
00267   /* proceed a step by step lookup */
00268   
00269   while( ptr_str[0] ){
00270    
00271     fsal_handle_t  in_hdl;
00272     char * dest_ptr;
00273 
00274     /* preparing lookup */
00275     
00278     in_hdl = out_hdl;
00279 
00280     /* compute next name */
00281     dest_ptr = obj_name.name;      
00282     obj_name.len = 0;
00283     while ( ptr_str[0]!='\0' && ptr_str[0]!='/'){
00284       dest_ptr[0] = ptr_str[0];
00285       dest_ptr ++ ;
00286       ptr_str  ++ ;
00287       obj_name.len ++ ;
00288     }
00289     /* final null char */
00290     dest_ptr[0] = '\0';
00291 
00292     /* skip multiple slashes */
00293     while (ptr_str[0] == '/') ptr_str++;
00294 
00295     /* is the next name empty ? */
00296     if (ptr_str[0] == '\0')
00297       b_is_last = TRUE;
00298 
00299     /*call to FSAL_lookup */      
00300     status = FSAL_lookup (  &in_hdl,  /* parent directory handle */
00301                             &obj_name, /* object name */
00302                             p_context,     /* user's p_contextentials */
00303                             &out_hdl, /* output root handle */
00304                             /* retrieves attributes if this is the last lookup :*/
00305                             ( b_is_last ? object_attributes : NULL ));
00306         
00307     if (  FSAL_IS_ERROR( status ) )
00308       Return( status.major, status.minor,INDEX_FSAL_lookupPath );
00309     
00310     /* ptr_str is ok, we are ready for next loop */
00311   }
00312   
00313  (*object_handle) = out_hdl;  
00314   Return( ERR_FSAL_NO_ERROR, 0 ,INDEX_FSAL_lookupPath );  
00315 
00316 }

00343 fsal_status_t FSAL_lookupJunction (
00344     fsal_handle_t         * p_junction_handle,   /* IN */
00345     fsal_op_context_t     * p_context,           /* IN */
00346     fsal_handle_t         * p_fsoot_handle,      /* OUT */
00347     fsal_attrib_list_t    * p_fsroot_attributes  /* [ IN/OUT ] */
00348 )
00349 {
00350   //hpss_Attrs_t    root_attr;
00351         
00352   /* sanity checks
00353    * note : p_fsroot_attributes is optionnal
00354    */

00356   if (!p_junction_handle || !p_fsoot_handle || !p_p_context )
00357     Return(ERR_FSAL_FAULT ,0 , INDEX_FSAL_lookupJunction);

00359   /*
00360   if ( p_junction_handle->obj_type != FSAL_TYPE_JUNCTION )
00361     Return(ERR_FSAL_INVAL ,0 , INDEX_FSAL_lookupJunction);
00362   */
00363     
00364   /* call to HPSS client api */
00365   /* We use hpss_GetRawAttrHandle for chasing junctions. */
00366 
00367   /* TakeTokenFSCall(); */
00368 
00369   //rc = HPSSFSAL_GetRawAttrHandle( &(p_junction_handle->ns_handle),
00370   //                                NULL,
00371   //                                &p_p_context->hpss_userp_context,
00372   //                                TRUE,     /* do traverse junctions !!! */
00373   //                                NULL,
00374   //                                NULL,
00375   //                                &root_attr );

00378 
00379   //if (rc) Return(hpss2fsal_error(rc), -rc, INDEX_FSAL_lookupJunction);
00380 
00381   
00382   
00383   
00384   /* set output handle */
00385   /*
00386   p_fsoot_handle->obj_type  = hpss2fsal_type( root_attr.FilesetHandle.Type );
00387   p_fsoot_handle->ns_handle = root_attr.FilesetHandle;
00388   */
00389   
00390   if ( p_fsroot_attributes ) {
00391 
00392     /* convert hpss attributes to fsal attributes */
00393 
00394     /*
00395     status=hpss2fsal_attributes(
00396                          &root_attr.FilesetHandle,
00397                          &root_attr,
00398                          p_fsroot_attributes );
00399 
00400     if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(status))
00401       Return(status.major,status.minor,INDEX_FSAL_lookupJunction);
00402     */
00403   }
00404 
00405   /* lookup complete ! */
00406   Return( ERR_FSAL_NO_ERROR, 0 ,INDEX_FSAL_lookupJunction );
00407 }
